title: List of Commands
desc: Access the terminal on your computer and view essential list of commands for mac, linux, and windows

title: Path, Folders and Directories (pwd)
desc: Learn to find the full path to the current directory you are in.

title: Computer Name (hostname)
desc: Find out the hostname/computer name.

title: Make Directory (mkdir)
desc: Make directory/folder

title: Change Directory (cd)
desc: Navigate forward or backward through the directory tree

title: List Directory (ls)
desc: Lists out the contents of the directory you are currently in.

title: Remove Directory (rmdir)
desc: Remove/delete empty directory

title: Navigate around (pushd, popd)
desc: Commands let you temporarily go to a different directory and then come back, easily switching between the two.

title: Create new files (touch)
desc: Create new empty files in current directory

title: Copy a file (cp)
desc: Copy a file

title: Read File (less, more)
desc: Use less and more commands to view/read files

title: Stream through a file (cat)
desc: Parse through a file in the terminal.

title: Remove/Delete file (rm)
desc: Permenently remove/delete a file

title: Pipes ( | )
desc: Use pipes to redirect commands.

title: Wild card for match(*)
desc: Select all types of certain files

title: Find Files (find, DIR -R)
desc: Search and find info in files

title: Look inside files (grep)
desc: Used to search text or searches the given file for lines containing a match to the given strings or words.

title: Command Help (man, HELP)
desc: ou can use the man command on Unix, and the help command in Windows to find information about commands.

title: Finding help (apropos)
desc: This command will search through help commands and find what you are looking for.

title: Environment (env, echo)
desc: Shell has these hidden variables that can change how other programs work

title: Change environemnt variables (export)
desc: Change an environment variable to something else, as well as unset it so it isn't in your environment at all.

title: Exit your terminal (exit)
desc: Close your terminal process.

title: Become a superuser (sudo)
desc: Sudo allows you to become a superuser or admin.

title: Change permissions (chmod)
desc: Allows you to change the permissions on a file from rwx (read, write, execute)
